Comment: Hi everyone. I was challenged to this game by one of my good friends (i played black). His rating was 1175 when we started, and I was at 1492. He tried my opening as white, and i thought i would respond with....
Nc6. I didn't really care for moving any of the center pawns just yet.

I don't like this move, and it's obvious why. White does control e5, but his white squares are weak and he creates a backward pawn on e3. For those of you who don't know what a backward pawn is, it's a pawn that cannot be guarded by another pawn. Thus, he has to commit one of his pieces to defending it if it gets attacked.
